definition[0]: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed
example[0]: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
example[1]: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
definition[1]: to gradually reduce something such as someoneâ€™s power or confidence
example[2]: Our personal freedom is being gradually eroded away.
example[3]: Repeated exam failure had eroded her confidence.
definition[2]: if an amount or value is eroded, it is slowly reduced
example[4]: Stock prices were eroded by profit-taking and ended down.
example[5]: The real value of the capital was slowly being eroded by inflation.
